block.p: Dr. Margaret von Mehren, an oncologist, and Dr. Eric Geoffrey Moss, a molecular biologist, were married yesterday by the Rev. Mark Ainsworth at the All Hallows Episcopal Church in Wyncote, Pa.
The couple, both 37, work at the Fox Chase Cancer Center in Philadelphia, where they met.
Dr. Margaret von Mehren, an oncologist, and Dr. Eric Geoffrey Moss, a molecular biologist, were married yesterday by the Rev. Mark Ainsworth at the All Hallows Episcopal Church in Wyncote, Pa.
The couple, both 37, work at the Fox Chase Cancer Center in Philadelphia, where they met.

Dr. von Mehren, who is keeping her name, is also an associate professor of hematology and oncology at the Temple University School of Medicine in Philadelphia. She graduated from Georgetown University and Albany Medical College. She is a daughter of Robert B. von Mehren of New York and the late Mary Katharine von Mehren, and a stepdaughter of Susan Heller Anderson. Her father is an international arbitrator and a retired partner of Debevoise & Plimpton, the New York law firm.

Dr. Moss is an adjunct assistant professor of biology at the University of Pennsylvania in Philadelphia. He graduated from the University of Rochester and received a doctorate in microbiology from Columbia University. He is a son of Elaine Bordeau Moss and Dr. Hugh Moss of Demarest, N.J. His father, an ophthalmologist, has a practice in Hackensack, N.J., and is an associate clinical professor of ophthalmology at Columbia's College of Physicians and Surgeons.
